SENT.plain: DNA contents of c-FMS and GM-CSF genes were analyzed by densitometer in nine patients with myelodysplastic syndrome or acute myeloid leukemia associated with abnormality of chromosome 5
Five patients with deletion in the long arm of chromosome 5 had loss of both c-FMS and GM-CSF genes
These findings suggest that c-FMS oncogene and GM-CSF gene locating in the critical region on chromosome 5 seem to have an important role in the process of leukemogenesis
